awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Linkage, Residual Intersections, and Normal Ideals
awd_abstract_narration: This project is concerned with research in commutative                     algebra. The principal investigator will determine conditions                   for an ideal to be in the linkage class of a complete                           intersection and will show that certain normal ideals are                       set-theoretic complete intersections. The Cohen-Macaulay                        property of residual intersections will also be examined.                            One goal in the study of commutative rings is to                           classify ideals having certain properties. Many of these                        results have applications to problems in algebraic geometry.                    An interesting topic is whether an ideal related by linkage                     to another ideal shares any of the second ideal's interesting                   properties, or to what extent it does so. This latter problem                   is the primary concern of this project.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
